Name: Biladi
Review Text: Marrocon food on his best, friendly staff, valeu for money

Name: Biladi
Review Text: Love this place! The food is great — the lamb tagine was so tender — the atmosphere is wonderful and the staff, especially the waiter, is so kind. I felt so at home there and would really love to come again the next time I'm in Amsterdam.

Name: Biladi
Review Text: A hidden gem in the neighborhood of old west Amsterdam. Stumbled by mistake when we were looking for a place to eat quite late at night as most of the other places that is not kebab related was already closed. …

Name: Biladi
Review Text: If it were possible to give 3.5 stars, that would be my rating. Portions were good, prices not too steep and the customer service super friendly - one of this place's stronger points. Unfortunately as far as flavour goes the tagine dish is …

Name: Biladi
Review Text:
Tajin and couscous was like home made very delicious and healthy Moroccan food in Amsterdam
Cozy atmosphere, nice Moroccan decoration!

Name: Biladi
Review Text: Really tasty authentic Morroccan food. Their lentil soup and raisin couscous are to die for!

Name: Biladi
Review Text: Their Harira soup reminds me about my trips in Morocco. Try it - it’s delicious and the rest of the menu also.

Name: Biladi
Review Text: Really tasty food and nice staff. So far one of the two best moroccan places in Amsterdam. Definitely recommend!

Name: Biladi
Review Text: Nice, small, Moroccan restaurant in non-assuming sphere. The food was great and portions more than reasonable. If you know Morocco, you will expect more heavily spiced dishes, which might make them the more accessible. I would have liked them with a little more "bang", but I was the only one who felt that way.

Name: Biladi
Review Text: A true gem in the middle of Amsterdam West. It is very hard to find in this city an inexpensive restaurant that offers great food , and this is without a doubt one of them. The food is marvellous (meat, fish, salads, anything!) and the …

Name: Biladi
Review Text: I walked 2.6 miles (little less than 5k) for this restraunt because it was the closest place selling coucous; it was completely worth the hour long walk. This is by far the best meal I've had in Europe and the service is good. My …

Name: Biladi
Review Text: Indeed, too bland. Quite not authentic. I ordered 2 chicken tajines. The chicken was kind of added later so no flavor in it, only boiled. The potatoes were not inside the tajine, but they were fried (!!!) and aside the dish (Dutch way?). …

Name: Biladi
Review Text: Super friendly folks working in this place. The food was really nice. Only downside was that the outside table is in the shade and the weather was windy. But that doesn't make the food less good :)

Name: Biladi
Review Text: One of the best restaurants in Amsterdam! Beautiful vibe, lovely staff and the food is just amazing. Their tagine just rocks :)

Name: Biladi
Review Text: Wow, what a gem this place is! I don't think I've ever been to a place with friendlier waiters than here. And the food... it's delicious, and the portions are huge! Definitely coming back!

Name: Biladi
Review Text: Delicious food, huge portion and a very welcoming family run business feel. I went with a group of my colleagues and we had a great time there.

Name: Biladi
Review Text: Delicious freshly cooked food, generous portions, homely atmosphere and friendly staff. Quite reasonably priced too.

Name: Biladi
Review Text: Good food! Nice small and cozy restaurant with very friendly staff! Make sure you order the harrira soup (during ramadan).

Name: Biladi
Review Text: Best moroccan restaurant in Amsterdam

Name: Biladi
